headline: Best-Ever Texas Caviar
description: This cowboy caviar recipe for Texas salad is made with beans, corn, bell peppers, and chiles in garlic vinaigrette for a delicious party appetizer.
name: Best-Ever Texas Caviar
recipeIngredient: 2 (15 ounce) cans black beans, rinsed and drained
2 (15 ounce) cans pinto beans, rinsed and drained
2 (15 ounce) cans white corn, rinsed and drained
1 (4 ounce) can chopped green chiles, undrained
1 red bell pepper - cored, seeded and finely chopped
1 green bell pepper - cored, seeded and finely chopped
1 jalapeno chile pepper, seeded and finely chopped

recipeInstructions.text: Mix together black beans, pinto beans, white corn, green chiles, red and green bell peppers, red onion, jalapeÃ±o pepper, and cilantro in a large bowl.
Combine rice vinegar, olive oil, sugar, and garlic powder in a pan. Bring to a boil, then remove from heat. Let cool for at least 10 minutes.
Pour dressing over bean mixture; toss to coat.

review.reviewBody: I make this for most family get togethers. We serve it with chips, but some just grab a bowl to eat as a salad. Tasty!

Just made this tonight. Of course I didnâ€™t have some of the ingredients (subbed fresh cut up garlic for garlic powder and mixed it in with the veggies and subbed red wine vinegar for the rice vinegar and I couldnâ€™t find white corn up here in Canada so used peaches and cream corn) and topped it off by being too lazy to cook then cool the dressing - I just mixed it together and then poured over the vegetable mixture and stirred it all . I loved it and my sister said it was better than a similar dip recipe that we got in Arizona. It was so good that she took some home (it makes a whole bunch - I changed bowls while making it) and she planned on eating it as a salad! I definitely like how it tastes light and has no tomatoes in it. Might become my new way of eating veggies ðŸ˜Š
We like this for lunch! A half batch feeds four adults. Frozen corn works great in this too. I much prefer this version to the one that calls for Italian salad dressing.

Cut the recipe in half and had to use yellow corn because I couldnâ€™t find white. It turned up too sweet and I wonder if the conversion tool gave me the right amount of sugar. I added lime juice and more cilantro to balance it. Overall it was good, we ate it with corn chips and the family liked it. I was expecting to like it more based on the reviews.
It was a very easy and tasty recipe that was a great hit!
This is really good and makes a lot, but It will disappear quickly in a gathering. I have used regular rice vinegar and the sweet rice vinegar. They both taste great.

Definitely a delicious crowd pleaser! I made as is besides used a half a jalapeÃ±o for a family picnic-was worried it would be too spicy, but next time I'll add recipe amount. Came home almost empty handed! This does make a lot so I won't make the full batch again unless it's for a large picnic again.

The basic ingredients in this recipe are a great starting point. I added avocado, chopped tomatoes, and 1/2 tsp. chili powder. I wasn't able to find black-eyed peas so I used small garabanzo beans instead. Furthermore, instead of heating the the dressing ingredients, I treated it as a salad dressing and mixed it in a glass jar. This recipe is always a hit.

Excellent. Quick, easy and inexpensive appetizer. Serve with shredded chicken.
 and salsa for a complete meal!
Delicious with tortilla chips and makes a nice light summer dinner. The dressing was a little sweet for me but it can be changed to anyoneâ€™s preference. Thanks!
Delicious! We use this as a dip and a bean salad. I use 2 cans of mixed beans instead the 4 in the recipe. And I hold back some of the oil and sugar.

This recipe is great! I used vidalia onion instead of red onion (red not my favorite), yellow and red pepper (green not my favorite either) and used some sweet hot peppers. The measurements are perfect and plenty of dressing with the amount listed.
Other than halving the recipe I followed the recipe as written. It was a little too sweet for my liking.
made a few changes, but its really about the dressing and personal preference on beans & veggies. I love it! also cut down on the sugar to 1/4 cup
This recipe is great and I get requests for the recipe every time I make it. Like others said, it makes a lot so I cut it in half, and then I cut the oil and cilantro in half again. Perfect!
Super awesome! The family loved it!!!!

Mine did not turn out well at all. I don't think using the pinto beans instead of black-eyed peas gave it any flavor. It also seemed like there was too much cilantro. I would add lemon juice to brighten the flavors, and use less sugar. It needed salt, and I think a can of drained rotel would be great.

This recipe is a good base to start from though. Just taste as you go. Season to taste and make it your own version.
I put the black eye peas back in for the pinto beans. I grew up on black eye peas. This the best recipe I have come across for these peas.
I put the black eye peas back in for the pinto beans. I grew up on black eye peas. This the best recipe I have come across for these peas.

I've made this like 20 times because everyone loves it, even the picky eaters. I think this is the only vegetables some of my relatives eat all year. I go a little stronger on the vinegar and lighter on the oil, and add a little salt. It tastes a lot better if you make it 12 hours ahead of the party so the flavors can meld together in the fridge.
Added Avocados and no Cilantro! Rick Loved it.
Really good recipe, large enough to bring to gatherings to share. I like it hotter so I added 2 addt'l jalapenos.
Easy to make and delicious!!

I had never tried this before, but decided to try it. It was delicious. Made it as submitted. Wouldn't change a thing.
Thank you.
This recipe is FANTASTIC! I decided to leave the cilantro out but I'm sure it's great with it as well.
Excellent party dip.
I replace the sugar with Stevia each time (I'm diabetic) and it works great. We love it.
I made it and added a couple cans of hominy and chick peas and sweet corn. --- Fabulous
I love this!!! I took it to a party and very few people tried it, but those who did really liked it also. my only change was to add some lime juice to the dressing (after cooking the rest).
Went over well for a work carry-in dinner. I added cumin to give it more zip and doubled the garlic. I will next time double the cilantro and use minced garlic adding ginger.
It was a big hit!!!!

This recipe is always a fantastic hit. Are use a quarter of the olive oil and instead of sugar use seven packets of Splenda three if youâ€™re cutting the recipe in half I also triple the amount of garlic powder. This recipe is fantastic with scoops but you can also eat it as a salad
I make this several times a year. We love it sometimes I make half it a great recipe.
I made this for a Halloween party. I hollowed out a pumpkin for the Texas Caviar and put the chips in a plastic Trick or Treat pumpkin. Yummy and Super cute!
It was awesome.

Mostly used for the dressing. Used a can of black beans, lentils and chick peas. Added red pepper, celery, red onion, canned corn, tomato, cilantro. You could pretty much use any bean or veggie you prefer. Great recipe

I did not make any changes and I've made it twice already!
Everyone loved it.
Gets many positive comments
yummy dish. Makes a sizable amount. Good for a party.

I followed the recipe to the letter. It was delicious. I enjoy the original Texas Caviar with blackeyed peas too but this is a nice change. Great on a hot Texas Summer day! Warning this recipe makes ALOT so cut it in half if you're not feeding a crowd. Our friends couldn't stop eating it!!

We served it with Tostito's scoops.
I was disappointed! The flavor was bland and the texture, mushy. Perhaps I did not buy high quality ingredients. I will try this again and use better judgment before making a final rating

This was so good, I made it as is and can't imagine it any better. Took it to a cookout party and it was a hit. Thanks for a great recipe, it will be a wonderful in my collection especially with smoked meats.

My second time making this simple, wonderful tasting dish. Presents beautifully in a glass casserole to serve, so colourful .
Not messin' around with this recipe!
I received so many compliments and requests for this recipe, everyone loved it!

I have shared this recipe 10s if times. It lasts so long in the refrigeratorâ€”you can eat as appetizer with chips, a side for many Mexican dishes, top off grilled chicken or pork. Itâ€™s a family and grandkids favorite!

I really liked this recipe - it gave me a base upon which I could play with ingredients. I can't resist adding ingredients to make it my own. In this case it was some chopped tomato and a good-sized dash of fresh lime juice. This is addictive stuff!
I made this as a bean salad instead of a chip salsa. I'll definitely make it again, but I'll probably cut the sugar in half. It was a bit too sweet for me.
Yes I will definitely make this again. It was a crowd pleaser!
Great!! Used 1/2 can diced jalapeÃ±o instead of fresh. Used only one can of pinto beans. Used apple cider vinegar instead of rice vinegar. Yum, yum!

Everyone loved it on Fathers Day. I made a few alterations. Instead of sugar I used Splenda and I eliminated the chilies and jalapeÃ±o peppers. I used one cup of fresh salsa but still added the cilantro and peppers.

Yes, this makes a lot and I cut it as well. My changes are that I cut the sugar out entirely and no one has noticed. I use habanero peppers instead of jalapeÃ±o because it kicks it up a notch. Other than that it's a perfect recipe and a healthy one at that!

Only made 1/2 of the recommended recipe, and we used fresh corn in lieu of canned or frozen. My daughter and I ate it every time we snacked for 2 consecutive days. Just purchased the ingredients again to make this weekend.

I likes this version because it didn't use black eyed peas, although I didn't make the dressing. Instead, I used a suggestion of one reviewer and used the juice of one lime + zest. I also added a generous shake of McCormick Perfect Pinch Mexican seasoning. Also I added some avocado. Served with scoops chips at a potluck... They ate every bite .

This was superb! I reduced the vinegar by 1/4 cup, added 1/2 fresh lime juiced and 1/4 tsp each cayenne pepper and cumin (so I gave it a 4 instead of 5 but only for not liking too much vinegar and wanting more spice). I took it to work (I work with nurses, md's, lab techs, pharmacists) and the bowl was licked clean! Everyone wanted the recipe! Its a keeper cowboy!

Definitely half the recipe, even for a party. Even half makes a rather large serving. I always add a diced avocado and tomato right before serving. It's always a hit. I add an extra jalapeÃ±o, a bit of cumin, cayenne (if it's not spicy enough) and more garlic. I try to make it the day before because it needs some time for time for the flavors to meld together.

This recipe is wonderful! I've made it twice and it's always a hit at parties. I only added cumin and avacado because I love those ingredients. I'd also like to try adding Rotel. Thanks for the great recipe!
definitely will make again. It does make a LOT, so halve it if you're just making for your own family but it's a great potluck or party recipe. delicious

I've made this twice now. The first time I made it as written and it was wonderful although a little sweet. The second time I used Italian dressing instead of the dressing made with the recipe. I didn't see much difference in the two and found it just as good. I'll definitley make it again. If I do use the recipe as written again, I'll not use as much sugar.

I made this with a few substitutions to this recipe: I didn't have cilantro, so I used it's seed: corriander; no red onion, so I used cumin, red cayenne, and salt; no pinto beans, so I used canellini beans. It still tastes great. I made this years past with cucumber and some goat cheese crumbles, too.
Excellent! just a note that this dip gets better the next day as it marinates! And remember to wear plastic gloves to dice the jalapeÃ±o!
My favorite!!

very good to great. i cut the recipe in half and it was still plenty. I also reduced the chili pepper heat when i made it for the office. Still a very big hit, many asked for the recipe. best yet it works for many on special diets !!!
This is always a hit! serve with cupped tortilla chips.
Great for a party. I cut down the ingredients and it still made a lot. Very delicious! I served it with tortilla chips.

Love this recipe! I have been making this on and off for years. I've served it as a dip but normally serve it as a side dish. Someone suggested in one of the reviews to try adding cold, cooked white rice to make it a salad, and I will probably try that next. Delicious!

In my desperate search for something that would taste like the Cowboy Caviar that I was able to purchase only once at Costco, I found this recipe. I've gotta say, this is VERY close! I made it exactly like the recipe, except for substituting yellow onion for the red, only because I forgot to buy the red onion. I didn't add jalapeno. I did add a squeeze of fresh lime juice. It is definitely a keeper that I will keep making!!!

Delicious!!! Big hit with my family!! I used apple cider vinegar because I didn't have rice vinegar! I used 2 cans black beans, 2 cans corn, and 1 can of white harmony (white corn), also i use 1 can of tomato checks with green chillies!

Love, love, LOVE this recipe! I halved it but still used used the full 4 oz can of chiles. Super easy to whip up. I can eat it with a spoon (guilty) but I prefer to serve it with scoop chips. The longer it sits, the better it gets. A++ in my book!

A client of mine made this for my office one day and after telling me where she found the recipe, I came right out and added it to my recipe box. I made this for the first time yesterday for a picnic with my motorcycle club and everyone loved it. They were even eating it without the chips as a salad. Made exactly as written, with the exception of garlic. I doubled it. I like garlic. :)
Sorry, but I found this to be WAY too sweet.

I like the size of this recipe. I followed the recipe, except I use a bag of frozen yellow corn. It tastes great and is more colorful. It freezes well, so I put 8 to 16 0z containers of it in the freezer. Then when we have company or just have a craving, I just thaw it out. It tastes like I just made it.
I took this to an office potluck and had many recipe requests! I did leave out one can of pintos. I added one can of drained rotel, 1 tsp cumin and 1 tsp black pepper.

Fantastic recipe! I have made it several times over the years and it always gets rave reviews! As others have said, the recipe as written makes a ton! If possible, make it a day in advance to allow all of the different flavors a chance to blend together, it's as close to a guaranteed hit as you will have at any get together!

I really like that this recipe made it's own dressing. However, the sugar was way too much for me - came out way too sweet. I would cut the sugar in half next time. 
I also like it less beany so I left out a can of beans, and used black eyed peas instead of pinto.
This recipe is so good I add it to rice for a main dish.
Love this ...only made half the recipe..it's a keeper...thankin you cassgirl.
This is my favorite version of Texas Cavier. Healthy, easy and makes a ton! Get a couple bags of chips--you will need them!
The picture looks like it is topped with shredded lettuce however do not see it listed in the ingredients. Do you top it with shredded lettuce?
I drain the dressing right before serving; makes it easier and less soggy when using with the "scoop" party chips.

This is the BEST appetizer ever! Every time I bring it somewhere I get asked for the recipe. One time I was asked about 1 minute after placing it on the table! It is so easy to make and it makes a ton. I use black eyed peas in place of the pinto beans. We even put it on our burgers sometimes! Love it!!!!

CASSGIRL89, this stuff is amazing! I made it with black eye peas instead of the pinto beans out of personal preference, but kept the rest of the recipe intact. I could not keep folks out of the bowl when I put it out for the tailgate potluck. It was gone before I knew it (so glad I saved some in the freezer for me!). A definite keeper!

EXCELLENT. I DOUBLED AND IT SAID IT WOULD SERVE 20 
OMG IT WOULD HAVE SERVED ABOUT 50. GREAT ON FLOUR TORTILLA WITH BBQ. I changed pinto beans to light red kidney. Beans and left out the hot peppers and then add green chili's
Very good! I doesn't LOOK so yummy, but once people start eating it, they can't stop!!
Very good. Obviously people can make changes for their preferences. We like 2 cans of corn to one can of black beans. Great for potlucks!
Good but I think next time we'll use less sugar.
Great in the summer with some corn chips.

It's not Texas Caviar without black-eyed peas, so I didn't even consider using black and pinto beans in this. (Not that I don't like both, but they're not for this dish) Used frozen corn and apple cider vinegar in place of rice vinegar. Very, very good, although this amount of sugar definitely means this is a pretty sweet dish. Use less sugar if you want the flavor to be entirely savory.

I never ever rate a recipe without eating a portion, but this is the one exception. I made the dressing as written, but the smell was absolutely atrocious and the flavor was even worse. If there was a recipe for "stinky gym sock bean salad" this would be it.

This was one of the prettiest dishes I've ever prepared. I used one red and one orange pepper (they were on sale) Everyone loved this , I served it as a side to sandwiches. I will definately prepare this often, it's easy and healthy. Will be great at a summer barbeque.
This is the easiest thing to make and soo tasty. I had a party and everyone wanted the recipe. Make it the night before so its flavorful! Great for an appetizer!

Very good recipe, half it and it still makes a large bowl. I will omit sugar, I only put 1tbsp. due to other ratings and the sugar does not belong. I'm draining it and redoing marinade without sugar. I also added ground cumin to taste, about 2tsp.
Yummo, the best ever!

Soooo good! I took this dish to a party and people kept talking about how good it was. It has a nice fresh taste. I cut the recipe in half for a group of about 20, and it was still plenty! I was sad when we ran out of chips.

I gave this 3 stars because I changed up the recipe to my own tastes. I made the sauce but after tasting it, the sauce is just way too sweet! Who wants sweet and sour Mexican food? I prefer spicy, salty, lime flavor myself. I didn't use canned beans (used dried and precooked myself), used fresh corn, roasted my own green chili's on the grill, added fresh diced avocado, white onions, fresh garlic and cilantro. I used a drizzle of olive oil, lots of fresh lime juice and some juice from a can of jalapenos I had on hand. I completely skipped the sweet bell peppers, sweet red onion, sweet vinegar, and sugar. Made my way, it was fantastic! Served it over barley I had precooked and then sauteed with garlic, CA chili and cumin. It made the best taco's ever! Thanks for the recipe. As a relatively new vegetarian I've been struggling to find things I can make with flavors I love that don't include meat. This recipe sparked my creativity and although I didn't care for it as written, it was a starting point for something I will make again and again. Thanks!
Excellent dip with tortilla chips. Even better the next day!

I've tried manh Texas Caviar recipes and this one is the very best. My husband doesn't usually like this type of dip but he loves this one. Thanks CASSGIRL for sharing.
cookngal
I make this whenever I need to bring a dish to share at work or family potlucks. It makes a ton, so it is perfect for sharing. It has been a hit every time I have tried it.

This recipe is great and was a hit at my Bunco party! Easy to put together. I added two plum tomatoes with mine. I did have lots leftover, but I'm okay with that. I'm just glad I have chips leftover too! :)
all i can say is FANTASTIC!
